data_findings.finding: Arrhenius kinetics feature engineering: Use 1/Temperature (in Kelvin), ln(Time), and their interaction as features. This is physics-informed and improves predictions.
Test Time Augmentation (TTA) for chemical symmetry: For mixed solvents, predict twice - once with (A,B) and once with (B,A) flipped - then average. This respects physical symmetry of mixtures.
Spange descriptors provide best base for linear mixing of solvents. Use linear interpolation: A*(1-pct) + B*pct for mixed solvent features.
Model bagging with 7 models improves robustness. Use HuberLoss for robustness to outliers. MLP architecture: BatchNorm -> Linear(128) -> ReLU -> Dropout(0.2) repeated, ending with Sigmoid.
Numeric feature engineering: rt, temp, rt^2, temp^2, log1p(rt), log1p(temp), rt*temp. Use StandardScaler on all features.
